chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer
Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick Deshawn Bills

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Patrick Deshawn Bills not in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Flanagan appeared by video for Patrick Deshawn Bills.  Attorney Grace M. Gall appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Patrick Deshawn Bills in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Patrick Deshawn Bills in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Deshawn Bills appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Allis PD Officer C. Sandvick. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  
Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and Filed:  Order Appointing Counsel at County Expense

Defendant Patrick Deshaw Bills in court, in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Thomas Reed appeared for the Public Defender's Office. 
Case in court for State v. Lee hearing.  Defendant appears in Court without counsel.  Defendant is eligible for public defender representation.  The Public Defender's Office has not appointed counsel.  Discussions held.  Defendant requests court appointed counsel at the county rate. Court appoints Attorney Patrick Flanagan who shall be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. Court orders defendant to repay the County $60.00 total upon completion of the case.  Case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Patrick Deshawn Bills not in court, defendant in custody.  Owen Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Patrick Deshawn Bills not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Patrick Deshaw Bills not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Patrick Deshawn Bills in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Patrick Deshawn Bills in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Deshawn Bills appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
